name: Scribbled Squares
description: Assignment week one. An attempt to recreate Dialog Between Emotion and Method created by Vera Molnar. I used randomness for colors and look, and played with stroke weight

name: Disco Dancefloor
description: Assignment week one. My first variation of Dialog Between Emotion and Method created by Vera Molnar. I played with randomness for changing color, placements and movements. I changed the map value in the get random value function in order to create more ordered sqaure shapes.

name: Conflicting method and emotion
description: Assignment week one. My second variation of Dialog Between Emotion and Method created by Vera Molnar. I used variation and reduced variance every third element, which becomes different. This piece reflects me being conflicted between being objective, organized and chaotic

name: Squares falling
description: Assignment week one. Recreation of Schotter by Georg Nees (1968). I started working from Grid example step 04, and then switched so the rotation occur with the y axis only. More and more rotation as the y goes further down

name: Squares falling
description: Assignment week one. My first variation of Shotter by Georg Nees. I used noise for coloring. The color fades between different neon colors

name: Bubble Bath
description: Assignment week one. Second variation. I used noise for coloring. The colors fade around rainbow colors, and also included movement. The circles increase ini size further down

name: Ocean
description: Assignment week two. My recreation of Slow Lessons, 2019 created by Tyler Hobbs. I used flowfield for movement and randomized colors with math.random

name: Its raining men
description: Assignment week two. My first variation. Two men and rain

name: Ebb and flow
description: Assignment week two. My second variation. The lines / water are following the movement of the mouse
